SEARCH
Package CORE

Class Simulation_Context

java.lang.Object
CORE.Simulation_Context
public class Simulation_Context extends Object
Represents the central context for the simulation, holding references to all major components and shared simulation state. It acts as a bridge between different parts of the simulation, allowing them to access necessary data and services.

    • Simulation_Context

      public Simulation_Context(Grid grid, PEC pec, PopulationManager population, SimulationParameters parameters)
      Constructs a new Simulation_Context.
      Parameters:
      grid - The Grid instance for the simulation.
      pec - The PEC instance for managing events.
      population - The PopulationManager instance for managing individuals.
      parameters - The SimulationParameters for the simulation.

    • setTempoAtual

      public void setTempoAtual(int tempo)
      Sets the current simulated time. This method is typically called by the simulation loop to advance time as events are processed.
      Parameters:
      tempo - The new current time.

    • getDestino

      public Coordenadas getDestino()
      Returns the final destination point (target coordinates) for individuals in the simulation. This is retrieved from the SimulationParameters.
      Returns:
      The Coordenadas of the destination.

    • getK

      public int getK()
      Returns the 'k' parameter, a weighting factor used in comfort calculation. This is retrieved from the SimulationParameters.
      Returns:
      The value of k.

    • getN

      public int getN()
      Returns the number of rows (N) in the grid. This is retrieved from the SimulationParameters.
      Returns:
      The number of grid rows.

    • getM

      public int getM()
      Returns the number of columns (M) in the grid. This is retrieved from the SimulationParameters.
      Returns:
      The number of grid columns.

    • getTempoFinal

      public int getTempoFinal()
      Returns the total simulation time (tau). This is retrieved from the SimulationParameters.
      Returns:
      The maximum simulation time.

    • getMu

      public double getMu()
      Returns the mean time for death events (mu). This is retrieved from the SimulationParameters.
      Returns:
      The mu parameter.

    • getRho

      public double getRho()
      Returns the mean time for reproduction events (rho). This is retrieved from the SimulationParameters.
      Returns:
      The rho parameter.

    • getDelta

      public double getDelta()
      Returns the mean time for movement events (delta). This is retrieved from the SimulationParameters.
      Returns:
      The delta parameter.

    • getBestFitIndividual

      public Individual getBestFitIndividual()
      Identifies and returns the "best fit" individual among all individuals currently in the population. The criteria for "best fit" are:
      1. Priority 1: Any individual that has reached the target destination, with the one having the lowest path cost being preferred.
      2. Priority 2: If no individual has reached the target, then the individual with the highest "comfort" level among all individuals.
      Returns:
      The Individual considered the best fit, or null if the population is empty.
